import React, { Component } from 'react' import Header from './common/Header' import Pen from "./assets/images/icons/life.png"; export default class Life extends Component { render() { return (

{/*

Life

*/}

Henry Adeniyi Ogunwuyi was born in Lagos, Nigeria on May 20thÂ 1974 at Lagos University Teaching Hospital (LUTH). He was the third child of Joseph Adeyemo and Margaret Mary Ogunwuyi. He died on 30th July, 2020 at the age of 46 after a brief illness.

Adeniyi started his primary education at University of Lagos Staff School and proceeded to Navy Secondary School Ojo, Lagos for his secondary education. During his time in school, he was very active in sports, most especially sprint races from primary through to his secondary school days with lots of laurels to show. On Inter-house Sports days, he was always the Most Valuable Player (MVP) and stole the show due to his swiftness on the tracks.

In 1995, he attended the prestigious University of Lagos, Akoka where he obtained his BSc. in Economics.

âNiyo Pumpinâ as fondly called was an extrovert and loved by most people he interacted with. He was a member of the ABC club in theÂ University of Lagos. His sociable life got him the award of âRookie of the Yearâ in his first year of university. Pumpin was always the Life of the Party.

Â  Adeniyi was passionate about his work and family life. He started his career in Corporate Sales and Customer Marketing. An authority in Corporate Sales within the FMCG and Telecoms Sector. He started off his career with MTN Nigeria, and later joined other top organizations including Virgin Nigeria, GBN Nig. Ltd (representative of Moet & Hennessy), EAN Aviation, Diageo Nigeria, Pernord Ricard and Wapic Insurance.

Shortly before he graduated from University in year 2000, he met and courted his wife - Oluwatoyin and they have been inseparable since then. They got married in 2007 and added two beautiful children to their Clan - Ademini and Adeolu. Adeniyi was a loving husband and father; all his dreams and aspirations was to ensure that they got the very best.

Adeniyi in his own words 'I am a lover not a fighter', was a protector of family and friends with a realistic view towards life. He was very playful and jovial, always trying to make anyone laugh no matter what life throws at you. Adeniyi was also strong-willed and principledÂ Â in nature.

He will be greatly missed by Toyin and the kids, his parents, brothers - Charles, Adedapo, Adetayo and Adeyemo(Jnr), aunties, uncles, nieces, nephews, cousins, in-laws and friends.

Rest in Peace!
